glsa.title: Perl DBD-Pg Module: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: Two format string vulnerabilities have been found in the Perl DBD-Pg module, allowing a remote PostgreSQL servers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: DBD-Pg is a PostgreSQL interface module for Perl.

description.p: Format string vulnerabilities have been found in the the "pg_warn()" and "dbd_st_prepare()" functions in dbdimp.c.

impact.p: A remote PostgreSQL server could send specially crafted database warnings or DBD statements, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All users of the Perl DBD-Pg module should upgrade to the latest version:
